content: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

content: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

content: Through pride we are ever deceiving ourselves. But deep down below the surface of the average conscience a still, small voice says to us, something is out of tune.
author: Carl Jung

content: To accomplish great things, we must dream as well as act.
author: Anatole France

content: The truth of the matter is that you always know the right thing to do. The hard part is doing it.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

content: Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action.
author: Walter Inglis Anderson

content: A thing long expected takes the form of the unexpected when at last it comes.
author: Mark Twain

content: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.
author: Benjamin Spock
Thomas Edison
content: The doctor of the future will give no medicine, but will interest her or his patients in the care of the human frame, in a proper diet, and in the cause and prevention of disease.
Your big opportunity may be right where you are now.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly.
author: Richard Bach

content: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

content: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
author: Cicero

content: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

content: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
author: Chuck Swindoll

content: Decision is a risk rooted in the courage of being free.
author: Paul Tillich

content: If you focus on results, you will never change. If you focus on change, you will get results.
author: Jack Dixon

content: Prejudice is a burden that confuses the past, threatens the future and renders the present inaccessible.
author: Maya Angelou

content: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
author: Laozi

content: Face your deficiencies and acknowledge them; but do not let them master you. Let them teach you patience, sweetness, insight.
author: Helen Keller

content: Let go of your attachment to being right, and suddenly your mind is more open. You're able to benefit from the unique viewpoints of others, without being crippled by your own judgement.
author: Ralph Marston

content: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Laozi

content: When people are like each other they tend to like each other.
author: Tony Robbins

content: Mind is everything: muscle, pieces of rubber. All that I am, I am because of my mind.
author: Paavo Nurmi

content: Do all things with love.
author: Og Mandino

content: You always have two choices: your commitment versus your fear.
author: Sammy Davis Jr.

content: You're not obligated to win. You're obligated to keep trying to do the best you can every day.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

content: Love, friendship and respect do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something.
author: Anton Chekhov

content: The thing always happens that you really believe in; and the belief in a thing makes it happen.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

content: All our talents increase in the using, and every faculty, both good and bad, strengthen by exercise.
author: Anne Brontë

content: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence; but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

content: If you think you can, you can. And if you think you can't, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

content: Nature and books belong to the eyes that see them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
author: Annie Dillard

content: If we have a positive mental attitude, then even when surrounded by hostility, we shall not lack inner peace.
author: Dalai Lama
Abraham Lincoln
content: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.
author: Aristotle
Woody Allen
content: I took a speed-reading course and read 'War and Peace' in twenty minutes. It involves Russia.
I am like a falling star who has finally found her place next to another in a lovely constellation, where we will sparkle in the heavens forever.
author: Amy Tan

content: Freedom is the right to live as we wish.
author: Epictetus
The Buddha
content: Ceasing to do evil, Cultivating the good, Purifying the heart: This is the teaching of the Buddhas.
We are either progressing or retrograding all the while. There is no such thing as remaining stationary in this life.
author: James Freeman Clarke

content: It is not so much our friends' help that helps us, as the confidence of their help.
author: Epicurus

content: It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

content: Our strength grows out of our weaknesses.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For while knowledge defines all we currently know and understand, imagination points to all we might yet discover and create.
author: Albert Einstein
Neil Gaiman
content: The one thing that you have that nobody else has is you. Your voice, your mind, your story, your vision. So write and draw and build and play and dance and live as only you can.
We live in a society bloated with data yet starved for wisdom. We're connected 24/7, yet anxiety, fear, depression and loneliness are at an all-time high. We must course-correct.
author: Elizabeth Kapu'uwailani Lindsey
Niccolò Machiavelli
content: No enterprise is more likely to succeed than one concealed from the enemy until it is ripe for execution.
